Description: Allow user interaction with the system through a tablet interface.
Measure and show the user how much energy they use to perform a lift. This data can be calculated by software through sensors.
Permit frequent users to sign in so they can track their performance gains over a long period of time.
Record videos of the lifter during exercise and allow playback for analysis of technique, social media sharing etc.
Allow user to change settings on when/how the system activates to help them when they fail.
Emergency braking system if the combined power of the system and the fatigued lifter is not enough to lift the weight.
Provide enough power to carry the full weight of the bar for safety purposes
Auditory warning to the lifter and surrounding people if the bar is about to fall, is falling, or is crushing the lifter.
Videos demonstrating proper weightlifting form on the GUI
Active demonstrations of speed, depth using only the machine and the bar simultaneously with videos.
Detect how much weight a user has loaded on the bar (adding up the plate values can be confusing)
Actuate spotting function with a button or pressure grip
Record and analyze video to determine when lifter is failing
Freeweights with frictional clasp so they don't slide off bar, don't need separate hardware to ensure weights remain on bar for safety
Robotic arms that mimic a conventional spotter but that are stronger and more reliable
Air cushion below prevents weight from clattering on the floor if the lifter fails
Use counterweights to reduce power input, and perhaps enable smoother operation
Use electromagnets to change the apparent gravity of the weight
Motors from below simulate gravity, no need to load weight plates onto the bar
Use a tensioned para-cord and spool to support the weight from above. Spool attached to the main driveshaft
Combine system with a full, specially designed weightlifting rack
Power the unit using batteries only
Plug the unit into a wall outlet
Lock the power plug into the wall so the system doesn't get turned off while in use
Include a backup battery to take over if wall power becomes unavailable
Allow the unit to slide to different locations along a weight rack
Easily change the height of the bar on the rack to adjust for bench, squat
Padding on the bar for comfort and safety of squat, bench, and overhead press exercise
Option to deploy a mirror to watch yourself during the lift
Redesign bar that shows spots to hold to balance bar
Redesign bench for better integration with product, possibly more convenient and ergonomic design than existing benches, easier adjustability
Option on GUI to share workout on social media
All mechanics and hardware are above the user, the weight is lifted by cables or straps
Weight support actuated through springs
Weight is supported on the ends of the bar
An AI system to ask a professional trainer any questions
Multiple grip attachments for the bar for user preference
Will ensure that bar does not fall below a certain height to prevent injury
Machine will be able to allow for free motion and allow users to have people spot them.
Depending on what muscles that have been worked, machine will suggest exercises for similar muscle groups or suggest for other muscle groups for full body workout.
Basic timer feature to do timed sets.
Depending on motion, will count full reps and ignore reps that don't pass a certain range of motion
Based on user's long term goals, machine will suggest daily goals in order to reach long-term goals in timely manner.
GUI functionality to allow for alternating users, streamlined partner lifting
Similar to library room reservations, useful feature to allow users at memebership gyms to have a set time to use the machine
Motor attachments to use physical performance to generate the machine's energy

Concept Name: Change weight of bar during rep
Description: Can make weights heavier through repetition completion to maximize performance or contrarily, relieve weight to make reps easier to complete at the end

Concept Name: Change weight of bar throughout set
Description: Each repition can be a different weight
Helps users extend arms for bench press before beginning set.
Allows for basic commands via voice, i.e. add weight, emergency stop, etc.

Concept Name: weight support comes out when prompted by user motion
Description: Senses specific motion that can be identified by machine to relieve weight from work out
Instead of overhead arm hangs, support comes from bottom.
Use with available freeweights/dumbbells/barbells
Share goals, workout details, etc.
cup/waterbottle holder on rack
Allows for side to side motion and other fluid motion within a certain range
Recordings of some random people saying motivational words of encouragement throughout set
Body attachment for calisthenics
Expand functionality to provide similar features for rowing, shoulder presses etc.
Expand functionality to provide similar features for use with dumbells
Link GUI and workout data to personal data from cardio equipment
Main exercises for product functionality
Include wheels or some other way to move product around
Application for use of product, GUI usable by both patient and therapist
Include graphs of power output, velocity, etc to provide feedback to lifter on technique and workout efficiency
Provide data on how much distance is traveled, during single rep, set, whole exercise, output shown on GUI
Linked smartphone app/GUI to track progress, explore potential workouts, input personal measurements etc.
Output how much power generated through lift over time, show as graph on GUI
Automated way to clean off barbell after each set
GUI has radio, existing tracks, can also sync with user's music. Speakers included on product.  Potentially include a visualizer
GUI output can be displayed in multiple languages
Can be collapsed or made compact for packaging and moving/shipping, as well as home gym delivery and installation
Hardware to dampen noise from motors, weights slamming, user outbursts etc
Can input food, sleep habits to GUI, can pair this with exercise performance and make suggestions
Rename to "Press Secretary" for humorous marketing purposes
Ensure that materials are colored similarly for homoegeneity and sleekness, for example matte black
Supports rotate into position when user prompts motion for weight to be caught
Instead of lifting weight, counterweights electromagnetically change to help with last few reps
Component to hold keys, ID, wallet, towel
